content: econo-shopper mesh bags large & small notes the schematics of this bag are very easy to increase and decrease to make it a size that fits your needs dimensions given are just a starting point i used a light worsted hemp/wool blend for the brown bag and aunt lydia s denim cotton for the sage bag my guess is that using a dk-ww yarn is going to get you measurements that are close to mine but of course you can always change that to accomodate a certain fiber choice gauge is not vital small mesh bag foundation = mulitples of 3 + 2 - using h hook chain 56 row 1 turn half_double_crochet in eighth chain from hook * chain 3 skip 2 chain half_double_crochet in next chain repeat from * ending with half_double_crochet in last chain row 2 turn chain 4 half_double_crochet in first chain space *chain 3 half_double_crochet in next chain space repeat from * to end of row repeat row 2 until you have a panel of smaller honeycombs that is about 1 ½ as long as it is wide your measurements should be approximately 16 x 24 for the starting chain given form bag round 1 turn *1 single_crochet in chain space **continue from * to corner work 2 single_crochet in corner continue from ** around join to 1 st with slip_stitch round 2 * work 2sctog over entire handle side work 1 single_crochet in ea single_crochet along long side repeat from * for remaining two sides join with sl st to first decrease round 3 * begin handle chain 70 loosely join with single_crochet to end of handle side work 1 single_crochet in each single_crochet along long side repeat from * for last two sides round 4 * make 1 single_crochet in each chain working into ridge along back of chain will create a more finished look continue working 1 single_crochet into each single_crochet along long side repeat from * around rnds 5 & 6 work 1 single_crochet in each single_crochet around round 7 work 1 slip_stitch in each single_crochet around fasten_off finishing work in slip_stitch around inside of each handle weave in all ends large mesh bag foundation = multiples of 4 +3 add 5 for foundation chain - with j hook chain 68 row 1 1 double_crochet in eighth chain from hook * chain 4 skip 3 chain double_crochet in next chain repeat from * until end row 2 chain 6 double_crochet in first chain space * chain 4 double_crochet in next chain space repeat from * until end repeat row 2 until the length of the large honeycomb panel is about 1 ½ times it foundation panel should measure appx 24 x 36 in for starting chain given continue in rounds using schematics given for the smaller bag variation substitute half_double_crochet for single_crochet in the rounds portion of either bag for thicker handles and a slightly different look this is licensed under a creative commons attribution-noncommercial-no derivative works 3 0 united states
